call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - January 23rd 2025 PART 2

topics.title: Community Positioning and Coordination Discussions
topics.summary: Discussion about positioning the Ergo movement and need for better coordination in the community. kushti mentions this is a pivot point for cryptocurrencies and proposes organizing town hall meetings soon.

topics.title: Sub-blocks Development Progress Update
topics.summary: kushti reports good progress with sub-blocks implementation, having a local miner-based DevNet generating sub-blocks with transactions. APIs for applications will be available soon, with peer-to-peer optimizations coming later.

topics.title: Ergo 6.0 Audit Status and Timeline
topics.summary: The 6.0 audit is nearly complete with one small issue remaining. After resolution, public testnet deployment and mining pool coordination for activation dates will begin.

topics.title: ErgodevDAO Restructuring to PID-based Temporary Organization
topics.summary: kushti proposes reworking ErgodevDAO into a temporary PID-based organization for 2025 with specific goals and funding targets. The DAO would dissolve at year-end and restart fresh in 2026.

topics.title: Treasury Management in Temporary DAO Structure
topics.summary: Discussion on how to handle treasury transfers between temporary DAOs, with kushti explaining the plan to transfer remaining ERG to new organizations each year. qx shares experience from Sigmanauts DAO transition.

topics.title: Ergo Protocol Stability and Bitcoin-like Evolution Path
topics.summary: kushti explains Ergo's protocol is largely complete and will follow Bitcoin's conservative update approach. Version 6.0 will be like SegWit activation, and sub-blocks are backwards compatible soft forks.

topics.title: Global Neutral Money Vision and Monetary Expansion
topics.summary: kushti outlines vision for Ergo as global neutral money platform supporting various forms of monetary expansion including stablecoins, tokenized assets, and ChainCash. Discusses building different types of money on top of the base protocol.

topics.title: ChainCash Off-chain Exchange Mechanisms
topics.summary: Discussion of challenges in implementing off-chain exchange of ChainCash notes. kushti mentions exploring ARK-like payment servers and federation-based approaches to simplify the protocol while maintaining security.

topics.title: Peer-to-peer Banking and Free Banking Network Vision
topics.summary: kushti explains vision for peer-to-peer banking network where everyone can become a bank, backed by collateral or trust. Contrasts this with current crypto industry's problematic relationship with Tether.

topics.title: Peer-to-peer Trading Platforms and LocalBitcoins History
topics.summary: Discussion of reputation-based P2P trading platforms, LocalBitcoins history and shutdown, and current alternatives like HODL HODL. Explores potential for building similar systems on Ergo using existing tools like MewFinance escrow contracts.

topics.title: Developer Bounties Across Ergo Ecosystem Projects
topics.summary: Over 27,000 ERG in bounties are available across various Ergo projects including ChainCash, Rosen, Oracle repositories. Bounties are denominated in different tokens including ERG, Gluon, RSN, and GORT.

topics.title: Lithium-backed Stablecoin Development Partnership
topics.summary: Dan discusses development of lithium-backed stablecoin with tokenomics team that worked on World Mobile. Plans to bring existing token from Polygon to Ergo ecosystem and importance of commodity-backed assets for DeFi.

topics.title: Index Funds and Algorithmic-Physical Asset Hybrids
topics.summary: kushti mentions Anon Real's work on index funds that could combine algorithmic and physical backing, such as lithium funds that are 20% algorithmic and 80% physical or other ratios.

topics.title: Cornell BRICK Token Integration for Architecture Students
topics.summary: qx reports on introducing Cornell BRICK token to 300-400 architecture students for peer-to-peer value exchange. System allows students to earn tokens for free plotting and printing services, with Tipperbot integration ready.

topics.title: Ergo vs Bitcoin Transaction Model and Smart Contracts
topics.summary: kushti explains UTXO transaction model where there's no send/receive distinction, just destroying and creating boxes. Discusses how Ergo supports all Bitcoin contracts plus much more due to richer context and opcodes.

topics.title: Ergo as Complete Bitcoin 1.0 Since Launch
topics.summary: Discussion of Ergo being designed as complete 'Bitcoin 1.0' from day one, flexible enough for non-breaking updates. Contrasts with Bitcoin's ongoing debates about tail emissions and demurrage that could take years to resolve.

topics.title: Ethereum vs Ergo Smart Contract Philosophy
topics.summary: kushti contrasts Ethereum's 'world computer' approach with Ergo's programmable money paradigm. Criticizes Web3 projects as meaningless while noting that Ethereum applications are ultimately financial despite the general-purpose design.
